description: Draft messages emphasize routine audits, promoting a facade of normalcy and steadiness. Technicians and Council members receive talking points to maintain public confidence.
State communications describe technical disruptions in the BCI as minor inconveniences, ensuring citizens that the core system is intact and stable.
Most citizens experience minor delays due to BCI-related service disruptions but remain calm, reassured by confident official messages.
Reports emerge of identity verification failures affecting access to services like healthcare and transport, leading to public frustration.
Council initiates an urgent investigation into the compromised citizen identity databases following reports of widespread verification issues.
Government offices implement temporary relief measures as citizens queue for identity reassessment, with officials assuring swift resolution.
